CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 11, 1954, pg. 12, reads: "Mr. and Mrs. James Spencer Jr... in handsome anniversary celebration." Portions of accompanying article reads: "Mr. and Mrs. James Spencer Sr. Celebrate Golden Year at Trinity - Mr. and Mrs. James Spencer Sr. of 2828 Wylie Avenue celebrated their fiftieth wedding anniversary at Trinity AME Church last Tuesday evening amid sparkling decorations of gold and white with 200 delighted guests looking on.  Four friends of the couple who were present at the marriage ceremony in 1904 at Shiloh Baptist Church attended the affair.  They are Mrs. Ella Smith Holland, who played the piano for the Spencers when her father, the late Rev. Samuel Smith, read their vow, Mrs. Viola Herrington Brooks, Shadrick Fields and Lawrence Howie.  The Spencers were the first couple married in church which had just been completed...The double ring ceremony was performed by the Rev. A. A. Nelson, pastor of Trinity. Mrs. Mamie Harriston of Braddock stood with the bride, and Howard was his father's best man..."
TitMainTitle: Rev. A. A. Nelson performing ceremony with James Spencer, and Mrs. Spencer wearing light colored dress and corsage, exchanging rings on their 50th anniversary, in Trinity AME Church decorated with lattice and flowers
